intro: Gerascanthus heterophyllus, commonly known as the variable-leaved geranium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Geraniaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its variable leaf shapes, which can range from ovate to linear, depending on environmental conditions. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and prominent stamens. Gerascanthus heterophyllus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in dry, well-drained conditions.
